did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: This is a collection of 30 items and documents pertaining to the Lebanon Creamery between 1887 and 1934.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Lebanon Historical Society.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], [Box no], Lebanon Historical Society

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was assembled by the Lebanon Historical Society from a variety of local sources between 1984 and 2013. There are seven identified donors and three unknown sources

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Jabez Manning (1824-1901) and Myron Manning opened the Lebanon Creamery in 1885 as a cooperative processing facility for member dairy farmers. Once the largest creamery in Connecticut, the Lebanon Creamerys butter was awarded a gold medal at the 1893 Chicago World Fair. Butter was shipped out via railroad to cities around the northeast. As demand and production decreased in the early 20th century, the Lebanon Creamery closed and sold its assets at auction in 1933. Local families either purchased materials at the auction or retained materials as former members of the coop.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: This Collection includes 30 documents and items, Certificates, Records, Posters, Receipts, Address books, Account books, Trade Catalogs, Stamps, Storage boxes, Photographs, Milk cans, Identification Tags, an Audio tape, and Annual reports, from Lebanon CT, which pertain to the Lebanon Creamery.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Oak box: 1998.003.001, Milk can: 1999.016.005 carriage house: overhead storage. Photographs: 1999.000.063, 1999.000.106 Museum Building, Archives: Unit C Shelf 2 Box 01. Annual Reports: 2009.024.001, Tags: 2001.013.005, Tags: 2009.043.001 Museum Building, Archives: File Cabinet A, Drawer 03. Audio Tape: 2010.038.015 Museum Building, Unit B, Shelf 4. Reports: 2013.022.004-014 Museum Building, File Cabinet A, Drawer 04.
